tests.description: SVG 1.1 Second Edition Test Suite: 16 August 2011

test.title: animate-dom-01-f
test.description: This tests the return value required for the SVGAnimationElement.getStartTime() method, as described in section 19.5 DOM Interfaces.

test.title: animate-dom-02-f
test.description: This tests that the methods on the ElementTimeControl interface return the undefined value, since the IDL operations are declared to return void.

test.title: animate-elem-02-t
test.description: Test 'additive' and 'accumulate' attributes.

test.title: animate-elem-03-t
test.description: Test inheritance of animated properties.

test.title: animate-elem-04-t
test.description: Test different ways of defining a motion path.

test.title: animate-elem-05-t
test.description: Test different ways of defining a motion path.

test.title: animate-elem-06-t
test.description: Test different ways of defining a motion path.

test.title: animate-elem-07-t
test.description: Test different ways of defining a motion path.

test.title: animate-elem-08-t
test.description: Test rotate='auto' and rotate='auto-reverse'.

test.title: animate-elem-09-t
test.description: Test possible values for 'calcMode="discrete"'.

test.title: animate-elem-10-t
test.description: Test possible values for 'calcMode="linear"'.

test.title: animate-elem-11-t
test.description: Test possible values for 'calcMode="paced"'.

test.title: animate-elem-12-t
test.description: Test possible values for 'calcMode="spline"'.

test.title: animate-elem-13-t
test.description: Test 'from', 'by', 'to' and 'values'.

test.title: animate-elem-14-t
test.description: Test 'calcMode'=discrete.

test.title: animate-elem-15-t
test.description: Test 'calcMode'=paced.

test.title: animate-elem-17-t
test.description: Test 'calcMode'=spline.

test.title: animate-elem-19-t
test.description: Test 'calcMode'=linear.

test.title: animate-elem-20-t
test.description: Test hyperlinking rules as they relate to resolved start times.

test.title: animate-elem-21-t
test.description: Test for chained animations.

test.title: animate-elem-22-b
test.description: Test which verifies that the basic facilities of declarative animation are working.

test.title: animate-elem-23-t
test.description: Test which verifies that the basic facilities of declarative animation are working.

test.title: animate-elem-24-t
test.description: Test which verifies that the basic facilities of declarative animation are working.

test.title: animate-elem-25-t
test.description: Test animation options for specifying the target attribute/property.

test.title: animate-elem-26-t
test.description: Test animation options for specifying the target attribute/property.

test.title: animate-elem-27-t
test.description: Test animation options for specifying the target element.

test.title: animate-elem-28-t
test.description: Test inheritance of animated properties.

test.title: animate-elem-29-b
test.description: Test compositing of animated fill opacity.

test.title: animate-elem-30-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animated <use> where the referenced <defs> also is animated.

test.title: animate-elem-31-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animation of the display attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-32-t
test.description: Tests the animation to and from the degenerate cases of the basic shapes. The shapes are drawn within the black rectangles.

test.title: animate-elem-33-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animateMotion with keyPoints and keyTimes.

test.title: animate-elem-34-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animation of attributes points and fill-rule.

test.title: animate-elem-35-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animation of attributes stroke-dasharray, stroke-dashoffset, stroke-miterlimit, stroke-linecap and stroke-linjoin.

test.title: animate-elem-36-t
test.description: This test validates the animation of the transform attribute on structure elements, hyperlinks and text elements.

test.title: animate-elem-37-t
test.description: This test validates the animation of the transform attribute shape elements.

test.title: animate-elem-38-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animation of the viewBox attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-39-t
test.description: This test validates that the xlink:href attribute can be animated on the <a>, <image> and <use> elements, using the <animate> or <set> animation elements.

test.title: animate-elem-40-t
test.description: This test validates that the x and y attributes can be animated on <use>, <image>, <rect> and <text> elements. The test also validates that the width and height attributes can be animated on <image> and <rect>

test.title: animate-elem-41-t
test.description: This test validates the operation of the animate element on the various graphics properties. This test is very similar to animate-elem-78-t which uses the set element instead of the animate element to modify graphics properties.

test.title: animate-elem-44-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animation of the d attribute of the path element.

test.title: animate-elem-46-t
test.description: This test validates the operation of the animate element on the various text and font properties. This test is very similar to animate-elem-77-t.svg which uses the set element instead of the animate element to modify graphics properties.

test.title: animate-elem-52-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test eventbase targets.

test.title: animate-elem-53-t
test.description: The purpose of this test is to test animation of points and calcmode.

test.title: animate-elem-60-t
test.description: This test performs basic test on the begin attribute, assuming support for the <set> element and setting the fill attribute on a <rect> element.

test.title: animate-elem-61-t
test.description: This tests validates multiple begin conditions in the begin attribute, assuming support for the <set> element and setting the fill attribute on a <rect> element.

test.title: animate-elem-62-t
test.description: This test performs basic test on the end attribute, assuming support for the <set> element and setting the fill attribute on a <rect> element.

test.title: animate-elem-63-t
test.description: This tests validates multiple end conditions in the end attribute, assuming support for the <set> element and setting the dur attribute to 'indefinite'.

test.title: animate-elem-64-t
test.description: This tests performs basic tests on the dur attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-65-t
test.description: This tests performs basic tests on the min attribute. The test is based on the SMIL specification at: http://www.w3.org/TR/smil20/smil-timing.html#Timing-MinMax.

test.title: animate-elem-66-t
test.description: This tests performs basic tests on the max attribute and on combinations of the min and max attributes. The test is based on the SMIL specification at: http://www.w3.org/TR/smil20/smil-timing.html#Timing-MinMax.

test.title: animate-elem-67-t
test.description: This tests performs basic tests on restart attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-68-t
test.description: This tests performs basic tests on the repeatCount attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-69-t
test.description: This tests performs basic tests on the repeatDur attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-70-t
test.description: This tests the animation's SMIL fill attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-77-t
test.description: Tests the inheritance of animated values on text.

test.title: animate-elem-78-t
test.description: This test demonstrates how <set> elements change graphics properties on elements from the 'Basic Shapes' chapter. For each of the graphics properties being tested, 3 <set> elements are set. The first <set> element acts directly on the 'Basic Shape' element. The <set> element acts on a <g> containing children. The third <set> element acts on an <a> containing children. In each case the test validates that the animated value set on the <g> and <a> elements is inherited by the 'Basic Shape' element. All the <set> elements have a begin attribute set to 0s with an offset of 1s after end. So, the animation will apply 1s after the document is loaded and will repeat every 1s after the animation ends.

test.title: animate-elem-80-t
test.description: This test demonstrates validates the operation of the animateTransform element and validates the operation of the different type attribute values.

test.title: animate-elem-81-t
test.description: This test tests the operation of the animateTransform's additive behavior.

test.title: animate-elem-82-t
test.description: This test demonstrates validates the operation of animateTransform with regards to the rotation center and with regards to paced animation.

test.title: animate-elem-83-t
test.description: This test validates the operation of the animate element on the <path> element's d attribute.

test.title: animate-elem-84-t
test.description: Test animation of color keywords that resolve to animatable RGB values.

test.title: animate-elem-85-t
test.description: The first subtest tests animateColor with 'to' and 'from' values including currentColor. The second subtest checks that the value of currentColor is the current animated value of the color property, by animating the color property at the same time as animating fill with a 'from' or 'to' value of currentColor.

test.title: animate-elem-86-t
test.description: [[Describe which section and what specific assertion is being tested by the test. If the test has a number of sub tests, multiple "testComponent" elements can be specified within the "testDescription" element.]]

test.title: animate-elem-87-t
test.description: This tests that the underlying value of a scale transformation is 0. Since SMIL defines a by animation as being equivalent to an additive values animation where the first value is zero and the second value is the by value, such an animation would begin by post-multiplying a scale(0) transformation to the element's underlying transform list.

test.title: animate-elem-88-t
test.description: This tests that any which space before semicolon separators in a values="" attribute on an animation element is ignored.

test.title: animate-elem-89-t
test.description: Tests clarification of value spacing of keySpline syntax; whitespace, or commas with optional whitespace, are allowed.

test.title: animate-elem-90-b
test.description: Test that the class attribute is animatable and that style sheets select on the animated value.

test.title: animate-elem-91-t
test.description: This tests that to-animations on attributes whose values cannot be interpolated are treated as discrete animations.

test.title: animate-elem-92-t
test.description: This tests checks the behavior of discrete to-animations.

test.title: animate-interact-events-01-t
test.description: Tests 'mouseover' event on SVGElementInstance

test.title: animate-interact-pevents-01-t
test.description: This test tests 'pointer-events' on text. Initially you should see four big rects with black stroke. In the uppermost rect there should be 10 'O':s with black fill. In the second rect from the top there should be 10 'O':s with no fill but with black stroke. In the third and fourth rects there should be no visible 'O':s at all. In the fourth rect there should be two green rects, and in each of the other three rects there should be one green rect.

test.title: animate-interact-pevents-02-t
test.description: Testing pointer-events and rendering order

test.title: animate-interact-pevents-03-t
test.description: Tests the pointer-events attribute with different 'visible' values

test.title: animate-interact-pevents-04-t
test.description: Tests the pointer-events attribute with different painting values

test.title: animate-pservers-grad-01-b
test.description: This test shows rectangles filled with animated gradient which inherits some of their properties: stop-color, stop-opacity.

test.title: animate-script-elem-01-b
test.description: This tests that the 'xlink:href' attribute on the 'script' element is not animatable.

test.title: animate-struct-dom-01-b
test.description: This tests that calling SVGSVGElement.getCurrentTime() before the document timeline has begun returns 0, and that calling SVGSVGElement.setCurrentTime() before the document timeline has begun will queue a seek to that time once the timeline does begin. After loading the test, two rectangles will be shown. The left rectangle indicates whether SVGSVGElement.getCurrentTime() correctly returned 0 before the document timeline had begun. The right rectangles indicates whether a call to SVGSVGElement.setCurrentTime() was acted upon once the timeline did begin. For each rectangle, red indicates that the sub-test failed and green indicates that the sub-test passed.

test.title: color-prof-01-f
test.description: The purpose of this test is to determine if an application can apply ICC color profiles to raster images. The same image is displayed twice; a color profile is applied to one by the SVG, so that the colors change.

test.title: color-prop-01-b
test.description: This tests the 'color' property and the 'currentColor' value on fill, stroke, and stop-color properties.

test.title: color-prop-02-f
test.description: Tests if the color datatype is supported. There are multiple syntaxes for specifying the same color, such as #37F and #3377FF. This test is focussed on the X11 color names, which are not part of the tiny profile. Each group of circles uses four forms - 6-digit hex, rbg() integer form, rgb() percentage form, and named ('X11') colors. It does not use 3-digit hex, because the colors used in this test cannot be represented in three digit form.

test.title: color-prop-03-t
test.description: Tests if the color datatype is supported. There are multiple syntaxes for specifying the same color, such as #37F and #3377FF. For each of the six groups shown here, each of the circles in the group uses one of the syntactical forms

test.title: color-prop-04-t
test.description: This tests the 'system' colors.

test.title: color-prop-05-t
test.description: Tests the color that is used for the currentColor value in the fill attribute when more than one color is specified.

test.title: coords-coord-01-t
test.description: Tests the default initial coordinate system used by renderer.

test.title: coords-coord-02-t
test.description: Tests the default units used for the initial coordinate system. This is illustrated by comparing blue boxes that have no units specified for their coordinates, with yellow boxes that have px units specified for their coordinates.

test.title: coords-dom-01-f
test.description: Tests the liveness of SVGTransform.matrix.

test.title: coords-dom-02-f
test.description: Tests the liveness of SVGTransform.matrix, that the SVGTransform object is updated when the SVGTransform.matrix object is changed.

test.title: coords-dom-03-f
test.description: This tests that SVGTransformList.createSVGTransformFromMatrix(), SVGSVGElement.createSVGTransformFromMatrix() and SVGTransform.setMatrix() all do not track changes to the SVGMatrix passed to them.

test.title: coords-dom-04-f
test.description: The test checks the SVGTransformList.consolidate method.

test.title: coords-trans-01-b
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-02-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-03-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-04-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-05-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-06-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-07-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-08-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-09-t
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of transforms. It tests elementary transforms and transform nesting. Note that for layout purposes, this test uses nesting of translation with the elementary transforms.

test.title: coords-trans-10-f
test.description: Translation is equivalent to the matrix [1 0 0 1 tx ty], where 'tx' and 'ty' are the distances to translate coordinates in X and Y respectively. The test overlays a group of black graphics elements with a 'translate' transform specified on top of an identical group of red elements with the equivalent 'matrix' transform and vice versa.

test.title: coords-trans-11-f
test.description: Scaling is equivalent to the matrix [sx 0 0 xy 0 0], where one unit in the X and Y directions in the new coordinate system equals 'sx' and 'sy' units in the previous coordinate system respectively.The test overlays a group of black graphics elements with a 'scale' transform specified on top of an identical group of red elements with the equivalent 'matrix' transform and vice versa.

test.title: coords-trans-12-f
test.description: Rotation about the origin is equivalent to the matrix [cos(a) sin(a) -sin(a) cos(a) 0 0], which has the effect of rotating the coordinate system axes by angle 'a'. The test overlays a group of black graphics elements with a 'rotate' transform specified on top of an identical group of red elements with the equivalent 'matrix' transform and vice versa.

test.title: coords-trans-13-f
test.description: A skew transformation along the x-axis is equivalent to the matrix [1 0 tan(a) 1 0 0], which has the effect of skewing X coordinates by angle 'a'. The test overlays a group of black graphics elements with a 'skewX' transform specified on top of an identical group of red elements with the equivalent 'matrix' transform and vice versa.

test.title: coords-trans-14-f
test.description: A skew transformation along the y-axis is equivalent to the matrix [1 tan(a) 0 1 0 0], which has the effect of skewing Y coordinates by angle 'a'. The test overlays a group of black graphics elements with a 'skewY' transform specified on top of an identical group of red elements with the equivalent 'matrix' transform and vice versa.

test.title: coords-transformattr-01-f
test.description: Tests that separating transform definitions by whitespace and/or a comma is supported. The test draws a red 'rect' element with a valid, non-delimited transform list. It overlays it with an identical black rectangle with equivalent transform list delimted by commas and numerical Unicode references of space (U+0020), tab (U+0009), carriage return (U+000D), line feed (U+000A), and combination of all five, so that no red is visible.

test.title: coords-transformattr-02-f
test.description: If a list of transforms is provided, then the net effect is as if each transform had been specified separately in the order provided.

test.title: coords-transformattr-03-f
test.description: If 'ty' is not specified for a 'translate' transform, it is assumed to be zero.

test.title: coords-transformattr-04-f
test.description: If 'sy' is not specified for a 'scale' transform, it is assumed to be equal to 'sx'.

test.title: coords-transformattr-05-f
test.description: If 'cx' and 'cy' are not specified for a 'rotate' transform, the rotation is about the origin of the current user coordinate system and thus corresponds to the matrix [cos(a) sin(a) -sin(a) cos(a) 0 0].

test.title: coords-units-01-b
test.description: Verify the conversion processing of percentage and fraction values relative to object bounding boxes. This is used when defining linear and radial gradients as well as patterns.

test.title: coords-units-02-b
test.description: Verify the conversion processing of CSS units and percentage values for both coordinates and length values. Note that the test uses the CSS px unit to be usable in all pixel resolutions. Hence, the conversion from other CSS units to CSS px is left out of the test.

test.title: coords-units-03-b
test.description: This test verifies both the initial viewport size and the support for the various unit specifiers.

test.title: coords-viewattr-01-b
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of the viewBox and the preserveAspectRatio attribute. This is a modified version of the sample file included in the SVG specification. It exercises the various preserveAspectRatio values and uses a general entity definition in order to make reading of the SVG source easier.

test.title: coords-viewattr-02-b
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of the preserveAspectRatio attribute on <image> referencing raster content.

test.title: coords-viewattr-03-b
test.description: This file tests the allowed syntax of the viewBox attribute. The viewBox attribute is a list of four numbers min-x, min-y, width and height, separated by whitespace and/or a comma.

test.title: coords-viewattr-04-f
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of the preserveAspectRatio attribute on <image> referencing svg content.

test.title: filters-background-01-f
test.description: Test background image processing.

test.title: filters-blend-01-b
test.description: Verify correct operation of the five compositing modes of the feBlend filter primitive. Seven rectangles are blended into a gradient, with text strings identifying which of the the five feBlend modes were used.

test.title: filters-color-01-b
test.description: Test which verifies the basic facilities of feColorMatrix.

test.title: filters-color-02-b
test.description: Tests the default behaviour of feComponentTransfer

test.title: filters-composite-02-b
test.description: Test which verifies the basic facilities of feComposite.

test.title: filters-composite-03-f
test.description: Tests the arithmetic operator in feComposite.

test.title: filters-composite-04-f
test.description: Test feComposite and the arithmetic operator to implement a simple dissolve operation.

test.title: filters-composite-05-f
test.description: Testing the feComposite element and that the 'k2' and 'k3' attributes are animatable. The result is an animated dissolve between two images.

test.title: filters-comptran-01-b
test.description: Test which verifies the basic facilities of feComponentTransfer.

test.title: filters-conv-01-f
test.description: Test which verifies the basic facilities of feConvolveMatrix.

test.title: filters-conv-02-f
test.description: Tests feConvolveMatrix with different values for the 'order' attribute.

test.title: filters-conv-03-f
test.description: Tests the 'in1' DOM attribute on 'feConvolveMatrix'.

test.title: filters-conv-04-f
test.description: Tests the 'bias' attribute on 'feConvolveMatrix'.

test.title: filters-conv-05-f
test.description: Tests feConvolveMatrix and the 'edgeMode' attribute.

test.title: filters-diffuse-01-f
test.description: Verify the basic operation of the feDiffuseLighting element. The test shows three rows of 3 images. Each rows tests a different aspect of the filter and shows the result of the filtering operation.

test.title: filters-displace-01-f
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the feDisplacementMap filter node. Six images should appear in 2 rows of 3. On the left in each row a test image of a checker board is displayed. In the middle column is the displacement map. In the right-hand column is the result. All displacement maps are generated as png files with gamma 1.0 and must be interpreted linearly for the proper geometric displacement to occur.

test.title: filters-displace-02-f
test.description: This tests feDisplacementMap without feImage. The input geometry is also used as the displacement map.

test.title: filters-example-01-b
test.description: A single filter that uses a combination of filter primitives. You should see a gray rectangle that contains a green outer ring and a green inner button with "SVG" on it, both having a 3D appearance.

test.title: filters-felem-01-b
test.description: Test which verifies null filters and filter regions.

test.title: filters-felem-02-f
test.description: This tests the 'primitiveUnits' attribute and how it affects other attribute values.

test.title: filters-gauss-01-b
test.description: In the upper left corner of the output are blue and yellow rectangles that overlap, they appear normally, no gaussianBlur has been applied. In the upper right the same rectangles are displayed with a blur filter applied, the standard deviation is the same for both the x and y axis. In the lower right corner the rectangles appear again, this time the standard deviation is different along the x (20) and y (1) axis.

test.title: filters-gauss-02-f
test.description: Test that when 'stdDeviation' is zero in one of X or Y the filter input image is blurred only in the non-zero direction.

test.title: filters-gauss-03-f
test.description: Test that when 'stdDeviation' is zero the result is a non-blurred image.

test.title: filters-image-01-b
test.description: An image should be displayed in the middle of the view area.

test.title: filters-image-02-b
test.description: Tests the animatability of 'xlink:href' on the 'feImage' element. The test will first show two blue images that should look exactly the same, then after two seconds both images should simultaneously change to show two pink images that also look exactly the same.

test.title: filters-image-03-f
test.description: This tests the feImage element with a number of different filter primitive subregion values.

test.title: filters-image-04-f
test.description: This tests the feImage element with a number of different filter primitive subregion values.

test.title: filters-image-05-f
test.description: This test verifies the implementation of the preserveAspectRatio attribute on <feImage> referencing raster content.

test.title: filters-light-01-f
test.description: Verify the basic operation of the different lights used in the feDiffuseLighting and feSpecularLighting elements. The test uses the same feDiffuseLighting filter, using different lights.

test.title: filters-light-02-f
test.description: This test verifies that the 'azimuth' attribute is interpreted as a clockwise value in degrees.

test.title: filters-light-03-f
test.description: Test resolving of 'primitiveUnits' on the 'z' attribute of 'fePointLight'. You should see some shapes that have a black border, three circles and three rectangles. The fill of these shapes should look the same.

test.title: filters-light-04-f
test.description: Test various values for limitingConeAngle in feSpotLight.

test.title: filters-light-05-f
test.description: This test verifies that the 'elevation' attribute is interpreted as a complementary value to the z-axis in degrees.

test.title: filters-morph-01-f
test.description: Test which verifies the basic facilities of feMorphology.

test.title: filters-offset-01-b
test.description: The target crosshairs should align with lower left bounds of the associated circle. The color of each crosshair should match the associated circle.

test.title: filters-offset-02-b
test.description: Tests primitiveUnits="objectBoundingBox" and relative values. There should be three green rectangles with thick black stroke.

test.title: filters-overview-01-b
test.description: The purpose of this file is to test the 'in' attribute on filter primitives.

test.title: filters-overview-02-b
test.description: The purpose of this file is to test the 'in' attribute on filter primitives. This test is the same as filters-overview-01-b.svg but uses gradients with gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse" instead for the FillPaint/StrokePaint.

test.title: filters-overview-03-b
test.description: The purpose of this file is to test the 'in' attribute on filter primitives.

test.title: filters-specular-01-f
test.description: Verify the basic operation of the feSpecularLighting element. The test shows four rows of 3 images. Each row tests a different aspect of the filter and shows the result of the filtering operation.

test.title: filters-tile-01-b
test.description: The test case constructs a filter that uses feTile to tile the entire specified filter region. The tile consists of a green rectangle over a larger transparent rectangle. The green rectangle is created with feFlood and feOffset. There is also a semi-transparent blue rectangle that should exactly cover one of the tiled rectangles, creating a purple tile with a black stroke (4 tiles down and 3 across).

test.title: filters-turb-01-f
test.description: Test which verifies the basic facilities of feTurbulence. Six rectangular areas showing the effects of various parameter settings for feTurbulence. The sample image indicates the parameter settings to produce the given image.

test.title: filters-turb-02-f
test.description: This tests the 'seed' attribute on 'feTurbulence'.

test.title: fonts-desc-01-t
test.description: This tests case show the behaviour of CSS font matching based on the font-size attribute.

test.title: fonts-desc-02-t
test.description: This tests the behaviour of CSS font matching based on font-variant attribute.

test.title: fonts-desc-03-t
test.description: This test demonstrates CSS font matching based on the font-weight attribute.

test.title: fonts-desc-04-t
test.description: This test demonstrates CSS font matching based on the font-style attribute.

test.title: fonts-desc-05-t
test.description: This tests a combination of font attribute matching.

test.title: fonts-elem-01-t
test.description: This is a basic test for embedded SVG fonts. The font "Comic Sans" (available from Microsoft) has been converted into an SVG font and embedded in the SVG file. The test contains two text areas, each with the character string "AyÖ@ç" drawn at the same font size.

test.title: fonts-elem-02-t
test.description: This is an accuracy test for embedded SVG fonts. The font "Comic Sans" (available from Microsoft) has been converted into an SVG font and embedded in the SVG file. The test contains two text areas, each with the character string "AyÖ@ç" drawn at the same font size.

test.title: fonts-elem-03-b
test.description: This is a basic test for external SVG fonts. The font "Comic Sans" (available from Microsoft) has been converted into an SVG font and placed in an external SVG file referenced by a font-face-src element. The test contains two text areas, each with the character string "AyÖ@ç" drawn at the same font size.

test.title: fonts-elem-04-b
test.description: This is a basic test for external SVG fonts. The font "Comic Sans" (available from Microsoft) has been converted into an SVG font and placed in an external SVG file referenced by a CSS stylesheet with an @font-face rule. The test contains two text areas, each with the character string "AyÖ@ç" drawn at the same font size.

test.title: fonts-elem-05-t
test.description: This tests the horiz-origin-x attributes on the font and glyph elements.

test.title: fonts-elem-06-t
test.description: This test validates that the font element's horiz-adv-x is used as the default glyph's advance when there is no glyph advance specified. All fonts have a units-per-em of 1000.

test.title: fonts-elem-07-b
test.description: This is a basic test for embedded SVG fonts. The font "Comic Sans" (available from Microsoft) has been converted into an SVG font and embedded in the SVG file. The test contains two text areas, each with the character string "AyÖ@ç" drawn at the same font size.

test.title: fonts-glyph-02-t
test.description: The first subtest tests the arabic-form attribute on the glyph element, the second subtest is the same, but with glyphs for the letter khah. It should match the reference image.

test.title: fonts-glyph-03-t
test.description: ISSUE: http://www.w3.org/2011/02/27-svg-irc#T22-20-51 - unapprove test for now

test.title: fonts-glyph-04-t
test.description: This tests that glyph selection is done in the order in the definition of the font element. The first line of text should be represented by two triangles and an 'l'. The second line should be represented by a square.

test.title: fonts-kern-01-t
test.description: This test validates handling of the hkern element.

test.title: fonts-overview-201-t
test.description: This tests a range of values for the 'units per em' attribute.

test.title: interact-cursor-01-f
test.description: Purpose of test is to determine if the cursor property and cursor element are supported.

test.title: interact-dom-01-b
test.description: Verify basic support for DOM event listener registration. The root svg element has an onload handler where a click event listener is registered on group element 'Start Button'.

test.title: interact-events-01-b
test.description: Test 'onload' event attribute.

test.title: interact-events-02-b
test.description: This tests that the SVGLoad event does not bubble.

test.title: interact-events-202-f
test.description: Testing event bubbling through 'use' element.

test.title: interact-events-203-t
test.description: Tests 'mouseover' event on SVGElementInstance

test.title: interact-order-01-b
test.description: Test event bubbling of event attributes, part a.

test.title: interact-order-02-b
test.description: Test event bubbling of event attributes, part b.

test.title: interact-order-03-b
test.description: Test event bubbling of event attributes, part c.

test.title: interact-pevents-01-b
test.description: This test tests 'pointer-events' on text. Initially you should see four big rects with black stroke. In the uppermost rect there should be 10 'O':s with black fill. In the second rect from the top there should be 10 'O':s with no fill but with black stroke. In the third and fourth rects there should be no visible 'O':s at all. In the fourth rect there should be two green rects, and in each of the other three rects there should be one green rect.

test.title: interact-pevents-03-b
test.description: Tests that pointer events are not delivered to text elements when the pointer is over any white space due to letter-spacing.

test.title: interact-pevents-04-t
test.description: Tests where text is considered intersected by the cursor when letter-spacing is used.

test.title: interact-pevents-05-b
test.description: Tests when text is considered hit by pointer-events. According to SVG 1.1 pointer-events on text is not supposed to use the text boundingbox, instead it should use the 'character cells'.

test.title: interact-pevents-07-t
test.description: Testing pointer-events and rendering order

test.title: interact-pevents-08-f
test.description: Tests the pointer-events attribute with different 'visible' values, same as the interact-pevents-201-t test but with script instead of declarative animation

test.title: interact-pevents-09-f
test.description: Tests the pointer-events attribute with different painting values, same as the interact-pevents-202-t test but with script instead of declarative animation

test.title: interact-pevents-10-f
test.description: An element with 'display' set to 'none' or an element whose parent has 'display' set to 'none' is not a target of pointer events.

test.title: interact-pointer-01-t
test.description: This tests that zero opacity pixels in a mask do not affect hit testing for the purpose of pointer event targetting.

test.title: interact-pointer-02-t
test.description: This tests that clipped-out parts of shapes do not receive pointer events.

test.title: interact-pointer-03-t
test.description: This tests that the "painted" keyword for the pointer-events property does not cause pointer events to be captured when a shape's fill falls back to "none" because a referenced paint server was not available.

test.title: interact-zoom-01-t
test.description: Verify correct handling by Dynamic (interactive) viewers for the "zoomAndPan" attribute on the 'svg' element. This is the second of three tests, and tests the default value.

test.title: interact-zoom-02-t
test.description: Verify correct handling by Dynamic (interactive) viewers for the "zoomAndPan" attribute on the 'svg' element. This is the second of three tests, and tests the value "magnify".

test.title: interact-zoom-03-t
test.description: Verify correct handling by Dynamic (interactive) viewers for the "zoomAndPan" attribute on the 'svg' element. This is the third of three tests, and tests the value "disable".

test.title: linking-a-01-b
test.description: This is the first of a set of three tests that verify the capability to handle links into SVG content, using each of the three fragment identifier forms permissible in SVG.

test.title: linking-a-03-b
test.description: This is the third of a set of three tests that verify the capability to handle links into SVG content, using each of the three fragment identifier forms permissible in SVG.

test.title: linking-a-04-t
test.description: Verify the capability to handle basic links out of SVG content using the 'a' element, with the xlink:href attributes. There are three subtests, in each of which one of three colored arrows comprise the content of an 'a' element. The link destination is expressed by "xlink:href=". The initial view of this test contains the three arrows, a colored circle, labelling text, and the usual template legend and frame.

test.title: linking-a-05-t
test.description: Verify if the 'a' element properly accept the transform attibute. There are three subtests, in each of which one of three sets of colored arrows comprise the content of an 'a' element. The link destination is expressed by "xlink:href=" as in the test 'linking-a-04-t.svg'. The arrows transformed is in the brighter color, and the arrows before transformation is shown in the darker color. The transformation parameters used for each 'a' element is shown on the left side of each arrow.

test.title: linking-a-07-t
test.description: Verify that the target attribute on the 'a' element takes precedence over the xlink:show attribute. There are three subtests, in each of which two similarly colored arrows comprise the content of an 'a' element. The arrow on the left, outlined in blue, has no "target" attribute; the arrow on the right, outlined in red, has a "target" attribute. The link destination is expressed by "xlink:href=". The initial view of this test contains the six arrows, labelling text, and the usual template legend and frame.

test.title: linking-a-08-t
test.description: This is a simple test for links on text elements. The upper subtest has an 'a' element inside a 'text' element; the lower subtest has the 'a' outside the 'text'.

test.title: linking-a-09-b
test.description: This is a simple test for links on tspan elements. The upper subtest has an 'a' element inside a 'tspan' element; the lower subtest has the 'a' outside the tspan.

test.title: linking-a-10-f
test.description: Test that the 'a' element supports various types of graphics and container elements as content.

test.title: linking-frag-01-f
test.description: Tests svgView(viewBox();transform()) syntax, with and without escaped semicolons.

test.title: linking-uri-01-b
test.description: Verify the capability to handle links to 'view' elements, and the permissible attributes on those elements. All of the links in this test case are internal, i.e., to 'view' elements in the same SVG file.

test.title: linking-uri-02-b
test.description: Verify the capability to handle links to 'view' elements, and the permissible attributes on those elements. All of the links in this test case are external, i.e., to 'view' elements in another SVG file. That file is linking-uri-01-b.svg.

test.title: linking-uri-03-t
test.description: Verify the handling of the allowable xlink attributes on the 'a' element. The initial view of this test contains a single green triangle, labelling text, and the usual template legend and frame.

test.title: masking-filter-01-f
test.description: This tests that the 'filter' property does not apply to 'mask'.

test.title: masking-intro-01-f
test.description: The rules are different regarding the geometry of a shape when clipping and masking. For example, a clip-path does not take into account the stroke of the shape used for clipping. It is however, used when masking.

test.title: masking-mask-01-b
test.description: Test to see if the masking features using the mask element and mask property are available.

test.title: masking-mask-02-f
test.description: If the 'mask' property references a 'mask' element containing no children, the element referencing it is not rendered.

test.title: masking-opacity-01-b
test.description: Test to see the effect of applying an opacity property to a group.

test.title: masking-path-01-b
test.description: Test to see if the basic clipping works using the clipPath element and the clip-path property.

test.title: masking-path-02-b
test.description: Test to see if clipPathUnits attribute is handled properly on a clipPath element. Only tests the userSpaceOnUse and objectBoundingBox items of the clipPathUnits. userSpace has been tested by the previous test as it is the default.

test.title: masking-path-03-b
test.description: Test 'overflow'/'clip' on outermost and inner 'svg' elements.

test.title: masking-path-04-b
test.description: This test exercises basic user-specified clip paths, using a text string (i.e., content of a 'text' element) as the clip path.

test.title: masking-path-05-f
test.description: Test to see if clip-rule property has been implemented properly.

test.title: masking-path-06-b
test.description: The intent of this file to test the 'clip' property. In this test, the clipped objects are raster and SVG images.

test.title: masking-path-07-b
test.description: This tests that 'clipPath' elements can be used together and how the clipping paths are intersected.

test.title: masking-path-08-b
test.description: This tests a few 'clip-path' cases to see that clipping paths are applied and constructed properly.

test.title: masking-path-09-b
test.description: This tests that a clip path applied to an element does not affect bounding box computation.

test.title: masking-path-10-b
test.description: This tests a few 'mask' cases to see that masks are applied and constructed properly.

test.title: masking-path-11-b
test.description: Test the mask element with child elements with white and black fills, to create a mask that clips out some text in the middle.

test.title: masking-path-12-f
test.description: Properties inherit into the 'clipPath' element and its children.

test.title: masking-path-13-f
test.description: Test that the children of the 'clipPath' element are not rendered directly.

test.title: masking-path-14-f
test.description: The 'clipPath' element itself and its children elements do not inherit clipping paths from ancestors of the 'clipPath' element.

test.title: pservers-grad-01-b
test.description: Test that the viewer can handle the xlink:href attribute on linear gradients. The top rectangle has a simple blue (left) to lime (right) linear gradient. The lower one has a different gradient definition, but should look the same as the one above, because the gradient makes a reference to the first gradient, without modifying any attribute.

test.title: pservers-grad-02-b
test.description: Test that the viewer can handle the xlink:href attribute on radial gradients.

test.title: pservers-grad-03-b
test.description: Test that the viewer can handle the xlink:href attribute on patterns.

test.title: pservers-grad-04-b
test.description: Test that checks the capability of the stop element in linear and radial gradients.

test.title: pservers-grad-05-b
test.description: Test that checks the capability of the stop opacity in linear and radial gradients.

test.title: pservers-grad-06-b
test.description: Test that the viewer can handle the gradientTransform and the patternTransform attribute on gradients and patterns respectively.

test.title: pservers-grad-07-b
test.description: Test that the viewer has basic capability to handle linear gradients on fills and stroke of objects and text.

test.title: pservers-grad-08-b
test.description: Test that the viewer has basic capability to handle linear gradients on fills and stroke of text.

test.title: pservers-grad-09-b
test.description: Test that the viewer can handle the gradientUnits attribute on linear gradients. It tests the following values of gradientUnits: default (userSpace), objectBoundingBox, and userSpaceOnUse.

test.title: pservers-grad-10-b
test.description: Test that the viewer can handle the spreadMethod attribute on linear gradients.

test.title: pservers-grad-11-b
test.description: Test that the viewer has basic capability to handle radial gradients on fills and stroke of objects and text.

test.title: pservers-grad-12-b
test.description: Test that the viewer can handle the gradientUnits attribute on radial gradients. It tests the following values of gradientUnits: default (objectBoundingBox), objectBoundingBox, and userSpaceOnUse.

test.title: pservers-grad-13-b
test.description: The purpose of this file is to test several values for focal points of radial gradients.

test.title: pservers-grad-14-b
test.description: The intent of this file is to test the 4 allowed spread methods for linear and radial gradients. The 4 values (pad, reflect, repeat and default) are available for both types of gradients. On the left side are the linear gradient results, and on the right, the radial results. The UA should render a result equivalent to the reference image.

test.title: pservers-grad-15-b
test.description: Test linear and radial gradient defaults. Includes testing defaults for linear grad x1,y1,y2 = 0%, x2 = 100%. and testing defaults for radial grad cx,cy,r = 50%, fx,fy = cx,cy.

test.title: pservers-grad-16-b
test.description: Test gradient stop rules. Including: No stops, like fill = none. One stop, like fill = black. If a stop less than all previous stops, it is set equal to the largest stop. If two stops are equal the last stop controls the color at the overlap point.

test.title: pservers-grad-17-b
test.description: This test has a gradient with gradientUnits='objectBoundingBox' which is a fade from black to white. The gradient is used for the stroke of a line. Vertical and horizontal lines don't have a boundingbox, since they are one-dimensional, even though the stroke-width makes it look like they should have a boundingbox with non-zero width and height. See the coordinate chapter, last paragraph of 7.11.

test.title: pservers-grad-18-b
test.description: This test shows rectangles filled with gradient. Several gradients are defined, with two stops:

test.title: pservers-grad-20-b
test.description: This test has a gradient with gradientUnits='objectBoundingBox' which is a fade from black to white. The gradient is used for the stroke of a line. Vertical and horizontal lines don't have a boundingbox, since they are one-dimensional, even though the stroke-width makes it look like they should have a boundingbox with non-zero width and height. See the coordinate chapter, last paragraph of 7.11.

test.title: pservers-grad-21-b
test.description: Test the inheritance of radial gradient attributes. The test has six ellipses with blue stroke, each filled with two gradients.

test.title: pservers-grad-22-b
test.description: Tests that transforms affect the rendering of a gradient.

test.title: pservers-grad-24-f
test.description: Test that the 'linearGradient' and 'radialGradient' elements are neither rendered directly nor via the 'use' element.

test.title: pservers-grad-stops-01-f
test.description: Test that gradient offset values less than zero are rounded up to zero and values more than one are rounded down to one.

test.title: pservers-pattern-01-b
test.description: Test that the viewer has basic capability to handle patterns on fills and stroke of objects and text.

test.title: pservers-pattern-02-f
test.description: Test that the 'patternTransform' attribute has an effect on the 'pattern' element.

test.title: pservers-pattern-03-f
test.description: Test that empty patterns are not rendered, and that the fallback color is used instead.

test.title: pservers-pattern-04-f
test.description: Inherited attributes from a referenced 'pattern' are not applied if they are already defined on the referencing 'pattern' element.

test.title: pservers-pattern-05-f
test.description: Test that a 'pattern' element can inherit attributes through multiple levels of 'xlink:href' referencing.

test.title: pservers-pattern-07-f
test.description: Test that an invalid xlink:href on a 'pattern' element has no effect on the pattern. The pattern dimensions and coordinate-system are defined completely on the pattern that has the invalid xlink:href, to test that they're not overridden by the non-existant pattern that is referenced.

test.title: pservers-pattern-08-f
test.description: Test that an invalid xlink:href on a 'pattern' element has no effect on the pattern. This test specifies only 'width' and 'height' on the pattern that is tested in order to catch incorrectly overridden values from a non-existant pattern. The result is tested with a reference pattern using slightly different syntax.

test.title: pservers-pattern-09-f
test.description: Test that an invalid xlink:href on a 'pattern' element has no effect on the pattern, and that the pattern isn't rendered since the default 'width' and 'height' is 0. A subtest that explicitly specifies 'width' and 'height' as 0 is added as a reference. Both of these cases should result in the fallback color being used.

test.title: painting-control-01-f
test.description: Elements are rendered when the 'display' attribute is set to any valid value other than 'none'.

test.title: painting-control-02-f
test.description: 'Stroke' attributes affected by directionality start at the point at which the graphics element starts.

test.title: painting-control-03-f
test.description: Open polyline and path elements are filled as if they were closed with the last point linked to the first point.

test.title: painting-control-04-f
test.description: A zero length subpath with 'stroke-linecap' set to 'square' or 'round' is stroked, but not stroked when 'stroke-linecap' is set to 'butt'.

test.title: painting-control-05-f
test.description: This tests setting the 'display' property to 'none' on an element that is a child of a 'mask' or 'clipPath' element, which should cause the element to not be included in the 'mask' or 'clip' region.

test.title: painting-control-06-f
test.description: Setting the 'visibility' property to 'hidden' on a 'g' tag will affect its children, unless the children of the 'g' tag override the parent setting.

test.title: painting-fill-01-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the fill properties fill:none, and fill with a color (fill:green)

test.title: painting-fill-02-t
test.description: The test uses the "currentColor" value for the "fill" attribute.

test.title: painting-fill-03-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the fill rule properties evenodd and nonzero

test.title: painting-fill-04-t
test.description: This tests inheritance of three properties: "fill", "stroke" and "stroke-width". There is a "g" element (id="G1") which sets fill="blue", stroke="purple", and stroke-width="5". The first two rectangles on top should inherit all those properties. The middle left rectangle has fill="yellow" and stroke-width="2", it should inherit the stroke="purple" from the parent container. The middle rectangle on the right has stroke="yellow", it should inherit fill and stroke-width from the parent "g". The bottom two rectangles are in another "g" element (id="G2") which is a child of "G1". "G2" sets fill="yellow". It should inherit the stroke and stroke width from the parent "G1". The two bottom rectangles set no fill or stroke properties, they should inherit through the parents, stroke="purple" and stroke-width="5".

test.title: painting-fill-05-b
test.description: Test using "fill-opacity" values for "rect" element. This test verifies that opacity is clamped to the specified range.

test.title: painting-marker-01-f
test.description: Tests the basic support for markers.

test.title: painting-marker-02-f
test.description: Tests the rendering of markers, specifically property inheritance. For the four tests, there should be two identical paths with markers drawn.

test.title: painting-marker-03-f
test.description: The SVG specification defines three properties to reference markers: marker-start, marker-mid, marker-end. It also provides a shorthand property,marker. Using the marker property from a style sheet is equivalent to using all three (start, mid, end). However, shorthand properties cannot be used as presentation attributes.

test.title: painting-marker-04-f
test.description: The SVG specification defines three properties to reference markers: marker-start, marker-mid, marker-end. It also provides a shorthand property,marker. Using the marker property from a style sheet is equivalent to using all three (start, mid, end). However, shorthand properties cannot be used as presentation attributes.

test.title: painting-marker-05-f
test.description: Test all the 'overflow' property values except 'inherit' on the 'marker' element.

test.title: painting-marker-06-f
test.description: Tests the basic support for markers. For the three tests, there should be two identical paths with markers drawn. The path on the left is rendered using the marker elements. The path on the right is rendered using the equivalent SVG, showing what the marked path should look like.

test.title: painting-marker-07-f
test.description: A 'marker' element with 'display' set to 'none' on that element or any ancestor is rendered when referenced by another element.

test.title: painting-render-01-b
test.description: This tests shows the same linear gradient used with different values for the color-interpolation rendering property. The top bar is painted using the default color-interpolation value, which should produce the same result as sRGB. The middle bar is painted using the 'sRGB' color-interpolation and should be the same as the top bar. Finally, the bottom bar is painted using the linearRGB interpolation, which produces a result visibly different from the top two bars: the white to blue ramp is whiter, the blue to red ramp goes through a pinkish color and the red to yellow ramp turns orange before the similar sRGB rampl.

test.title: painting-render-02-b
test.description: This tests that the 'color-interpolation' property is honored when alpha compositing is performed.

test.title: painting-stroke-01-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the stroke properties ("stroke") in combination with the "rect" element . The pair should be rendered as two blue rectangles, the upper one without a stroke and the lower with a green stroke.

test.title: painting-stroke-02-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the stroke properties ("stroke", "stroke-width", "stroke-linejoin") in combination with the "rect" element.

test.title: painting-stroke-03-t
test.description: This test checks the basic capability of handling the stroke properties ("stroke", "stroke-width" "stroke-linejoin", "stroke-linecap", "stroke-miterlimit") with straight-line path commands.

test.title: painting-stroke-04-t
test.description: This test checks the "stroke-dasharray" and "stroke-dashoffset" properties. Two lines are drawn, one blue and one black. Both have a "stroke-dasharray" of "10,10" giving a dashed appearance where the size of the gaps and the size of the dash is equal.

test.title: painting-stroke-05-t
test.description: User agents may render graphical primitives with different levels of accuracy. This test is aimed at determining how a UA renders thin strokes.

test.title: painting-stroke-06-t
test.description: Test default effects of stroke-dasharray.

test.title: painting-stroke-07-t
test.description: Test effect of different stroke-miterlimits. For this particular combination of stroke width and angle, the cut off value of stroke-miterlimit is 18.028.

test.title: painting-stroke-08-t
test.description: Test effects of stroke-opacity range. Values outside the range 0-1.0 must be clamped.

test.title: painting-stroke-09-t
test.description: This tests that the "stroke-dasharray" property accepts values that are separated by white space.

test.title: painting-stroke-10-t
test.description: This tests that stroking of zero length subpaths will result in some rendering if the 'stroke-linecap' property is set to 'square' or 'round', but not if it is set to 'butt'.

test.title: paths-data-01-t
test.description: Test that the viewer has the basic capability to handle the 'path' element and its data (d) attribute in combination with the cubic Bezier curveto commands, C, c, S, s (plus Mm and Zz).

test.title: paths-data-02-t
test.description: Test that the viewer has the basic capability to handle the 'path' element and its data (d) attribute in combination with the quadratic Bezier curveto commands, Q, q, T, t (plus Mm and Zz).

test.title: paths-data-03-f
test.description: Test that the viewer has the basic capability to handle the 'path' element and its data (d) attribute in combination with the elliptical arc curveto commands, A, a (plus Mm and Zz).

test.title: paths-data-04-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the 'path' element, and its data attribute (d) in combination with the straight-line path commands. Two pairs of concentric equilateral triangles are drawn using respectively M,L,Z and m,l,z. The shapes are identical, with one stroked and one filled. The fill-mode default of "even-odd" means that the inner triangle is hollow.

test.title: paths-data-05-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the 'path' element, and its data attribute (d) in combination with the straight-line path commands. Two pairs of concentric equilateral triangles are drawn using respectively M,L,Z and m,l,z. The shapes in each pair are identical, with one stroked and one filled. The fill-mode default of "even-odd" means that the inner triangle is hollow.

test.title: paths-data-06-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the 'path' element, and its data attribute (d) in combination with the straight-line path commands. Two pairs of staircase figures are drawn using respectively M,H,V,Z and m,h,v,z. The shapes in each pair are identical, with one stroked and one filled.

test.title: paths-data-07-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the 'path' element, and its data attribute (d) in combination with the straight-line path commands. Two pairs of staircase figures are drawn using respectively M,H,V,Z and m,h,v,z. The shapes in each pair are identical, with one stroked and one filled.

test.title: paths-data-08-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the 'path' element, and its data attribute (d) in combination with the straight-line path commands. Two pairs of concentric equilateral triangles are drawn using M and Z. No L commands are used in this test as they are implied after an M or Z command. The shapes are identical, with one stroked and one filled. The fill-mode default of "even-odd" means that the inner triangle is hollow.

test.title: paths-data-09-t
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the 'path' element, and its data attribute (d) in combination with the straight-line path commands. Two pairs of concentric equilateral triangles are drawn using m and z. No l commands are used in this test as they are implied after an m or z command. The shapes are identical, with one stroked and one filled. The fill-mode default of "even-odd" means that the inner triangle is hollow.

test.title: paths-data-10-t
test.description: Verify that the viewer renders the line caps and line joins for open and closed paths properly. Verify that the open triangular paths are stroked differently at ends of the path than they are at their intermediate corners. In contrast, the corners of a closed path should all appear the same.

test.title: paths-data-12-t
test.description: Test using multiple coord sets to build a polybeizer, and implicit values for initial S.

test.title: paths-data-13-t
test.description: Test multiple coordinates for V and H.

test.title: paths-data-14-t

test.description: Verifies that text can be stroked. The

test.title: render-groups-03-t
test.description: Verifies implicit rendering order (paragraph 3.3) and grouping mechanism (paragraphs 3.4). It also validates basic Shape, Image and text rendering.

test.description: Tests basic mouse event handlers.

test.title: script-handle-04-b

The test uses an unknown (bogus) script language, which looks exactly like ECMAScript.

test.title: script-specify-02-f

The test uses an unknown (bogus) script language, which looks exactly like ECMAScript.

test.title: shapes-rect-04-f

test.title: struct-dom-03-b
test.description: Verify the basic capability to handle the hasFeature DOMImplementation method. The DOMImplementation instance is retrieved from the Document instance. Then, its hasFeature method is invoked on the various SVG feature strings.

test.title: struct-dom-04-b

This handler invokes core (i.e., non SVG specific) DOM API methods to modify the document's content: it removes an element, modifies an attribute and adds elements.

test.description: The svg contains three use elements that each reference three rects from an svg element in the document. Before the onload-script is run there should be 9 red rects visible. The script changes the fill of the rects to be green.

test.title: struct-dom-08-f
test.description: This tests that SVGSVGElement.unsuspendRedraw() does not throw an exception if the redraw suspend timeout has elapsed. After loading the test, wait for one second. Some time before the one second has elapsed, the rectangle should change color to indicate the result of the test: black if the test did not run, red if the test failed and green if the test passed.

test.title: struct-dom-11-f
test.description: This tests that the getIntersectionList() and getEnclosureList() methods return NodeLists that are not live.

test.title: struct-group-03-t

Both files (referencing and referenced) define similar colors/gradients via 'color', 'linearGradient' and 'radialGradient'. The ids of those definitions are the same but the actual appearance are different. These definitions are used to test the property inheritance feature of SVG.

The rect elements in the external file have onclick attributes, and the handler will attempt to change the fill of the referenced rect element to red.

It also tests that the SVGElementInstance.correspondingElement property and the CSSStyleDeclaration.setProperty() method defined in DOM Level 2 Style. By testing different ways of setting the fill on a rectangle it verifies that the result is consistent, and that CSS properly overrides the specified values.

test.title: struct-use-15-f

test.description: This tests that a presentation attribute that is not relevant to a given element which is otherwise stylable is correctly stored in the property collection for that element. In particular, it tests the following presentation attributes:

test.title: text-align-08-b
test.description: ISSUE - http://www.w3.org/2011/02/27-svg-irc#T22-20-51

test.description: Test 'altGlyph' facilities and many-to-many chars to glyphs.
